body:
> scvg17: inuse: 36, idle: 108, sys: 145, released: 108, consumed: 36 (MB)

The garbage collector has told the operating system that we don't need 108 mb of the 145 that has been allocated from the operating system. Some operating systems ignore this advice, especially when free memory is plentiful on the system.

Top is not a useful tool for measuring memory use on linux systems. 

I do not believe there is an issue here.
